LongitudinalBunchMethod: Bunch length and relative energy spread (SIGT, SIGE)

sigx: The horizontal extent of the opposite beam.
sigy: The vertical extent of the opposite beam.
xma: The horizontal displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.
yma: The vertical displacement of the opposite beam with respect to the ideal orbit.
charge: The charge of particles in the opposite beam in elementary charges.
bbshape: The parameter to choose the radial density shape of the opposite beam.
width: The relative extent of the edge region.
bbdir: The direction of motion of the opposite beam relative to the beam considered.

rv1: Number of initial turns with zero voltage.
rv2: Number of turns to ramp voltage from zero to nominal.
rv3: Number of turns with nominal voltage.
rv4: Number of turns to ramp voltage from nominal to zero.
rph1: Number of initial turns with nominal phase.
rph2: Number of turns to ramp phase [2$\pi$] from nominal to specified value.
lagf: Value of the final crab RF phase lag

e1: The rotation angle for the pole face.
hgap: Half gap height of the associated SBEND
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

lrad: A fictitious length, which was originally just used to compute synchrotron radiation effects.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
knl: The normal multipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.
ksl: The skew multipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
The roll angle about the longitudinal axis
thick: If this logical flag is set to true the quadrupole is tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
e1: The rotation angle for the entrance pole face.
e2: The rotation angle for the exit pole face.
fint: The fringe field integral at the entrance and exit of the bend.
fintx: If defined and positive, the fringe field integral at the exit of the element, overriding FINT for the exit.
hgap: The half gap of the magnet.
h1: The curvature of the entrance pole face.
h2: The curvature of the exit pole face.
add_angle: An array of (maximum 5) bending angles for multiple passes.
thick: If this logical flag is set to true the bending magnet will be tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

lrad: A fictitious length, which was originally just used to compute synchrotron radiation effects.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
ksl: The skew rfmultipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.
pnl: The phase for each normal rfmultipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.
psl: The phase for each skew rfmultipole coefficients from order zero to the maximum.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.
e1: The rotation angle for the entrance pole face.
e2: The rotation angle for the exit pole face.
fint: The fringe field integral at the entrance and exit of the bend.
fintx: If defined and positive, the fringe field integral at the exit of the element, overriding FINT for the exit.
hgap: The half gap of the magnet.
h1: The curvature of the entrance pole face.
h2: The curvature of the exit pole face.
thick: If this logical flag is set to true the bending magnet will be tracked through as a thick-element, instead of being converted into thin-lenses.

tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

l: The length of the closed orbit corrector.
tilt: The roll angle about the longitudinal axis.

BEAMBEAM.title: BEAMBEAM
BEAMBEAM.description: A straight magnetic field element using generalized gradient expansion.

CHANGEREF.title: CHANGEREF
CHANGEREF.description: The element CHANGEREF changes the reference system by applying both translations and rotations.

DIPEDGE.title: DIPEDGE
DIPEDGE.description: A thin element describing the edge focusing of a dipole has been introduced in order to make it possible to track trajectories in the presence of dipoles with pole face angles. Only linear terms are considered since the higher order terms would make the tracking non-symplectic.

HACDIPOLE.title: HACDIPOLE
HACDIPOLE.description: An AC dipole for the horizontal plane

HKICKER.title: HKICKER
HKICKER.description: A corrector for the horizontal plane

HMONITOR.title: HMONITOR
HMONITOR.description: Monitor for the horizontal beam position

INSTRUMENT.title: INSTRUMENT
INSTRUMENT.description: An instrument or a placeholder has no specific effect on the beam and behaves like a drift space. An instrument is different from beam a position monitor and is not used for closed orbit correction.

MARKER.title: MARKER
MARKER.description: The MARKER has zero length and has no effect on the beam, but it allows one to identify a position in the beam line, for example to apply a matching constraint.

MATRIX.title: MATRIX
MATRIX.description: The MATRIX element allows the definition of an arbitrary transfer matrix.

MONITOR.title: MONITOR
MONITOR.description: A beam monitor has no specific effect on the beam and behaves like a drift space. In addition it serves to record the beam position for closed orbit correction.

MULTIPOLE.title: MULTIPOLE
MULTIPOLE.description: A MULTIPOLE is a thin-lens magnet of arbitrary order, including a dipole component.

NLLENS.title: NLLENS
NLLENS.description: The NLLENS element represents a thin nonlinear lens with the potential of 'Elliptic' type. The lens is used to create fully integrable 2D nonlinear accelerator lattice with very large nonlinear tune spread/shift. The NLLENS element is recognized by the thin tracking module. The quadrupole term of the potential is included in the transport map and, consequently, affects the calculation of tunes and Twiss functions.

PLACEHOLDER.title: PLACEHOLDER
PLACEHOLDER.description: An instrument or a placeholder has no specific effect on the beam and behaves like a drift space. An instrument is different from beam a position monitor and is not used for closed orbit correction.

RBEND.title: RBEND
RBEND.description: RBEND is a specific case of SBEND. The pole faces are parallel. The reference system is the curved rbend reference system.

RFMULTIPOLE.title: RFMULTIPOLE
RFMULTIPOLE.description: A RFMULTIPOLE is a element which exhibits the properties of an RF cavity as well as those of a multipole, of arbitrary order, oscillating at the same RF frequency.

SBEND.title: SBEND
SBEND.description: SBEND is a sector bending magnet. The planes of the pole faces intersect at the centre of curvature of the curved sbend reference system.

SROTATION.title: SROTATION
SROTATION.description: The element SROTATION rotates the straight reference system about the longitudinal (s) axis.

TRANSLATION.title: TRANSLATION
TRANSLATION.description: The element TRANSLATION changes the reference system by applying a translation of the reference system.

TWCAVITY.title: TWCAVITY
TWCAVITY.description: The travelling wave cavities model the accelerating structures of linacs where wavefront moves together with the accelerated particles. This element is implemented only by PTC and is treated as drift by native MADX commands. The phase velocity is fixed to speed of light and can not be varied.

VACDIPOLE.title: VACDIPOLE
VACDIPOLE.description: An AC dipole for the vertical plane

VKICKER.title: VKICKER
VKICKER.description: A corrector for the vertical plane

VMONITOR.title: VMONITOR
VMONITOR.description: Monitor for the vertical beam position

XROTATION.title: XROTATION
XROTATION.description: The element XROTATION rotates the straight reference system about the vertical (x) axis.

YROTATION.title: YROTATION
YROTATION.description: The element YROTATION rotates the straight reference system about the vertical (y) axis.
